H0.text: Who won the most of the first ten tournaments called the Women's Hockey World Cup (the field hockey World Cup competition for women), which was inaugurated in 1974. Australia

H1.text: Who won the most of the first ten tournaments called the Women's Hockey World Cup (the field hockey World Cup competition for women), which was inaugurated in 1974. England

H2.text: Who won the most of the first ten tournaments called the Women's Hockey World Cup (the field hockey World Cup competition for women), which was inaugurated in 1974. Germany

H3.text: Who won the most of the first ten tournaments called the Women's Hockey World Cup (the field hockey World Cup competition for women), which was inaugurated in 1974. Olanda

A4.text: Netherlands is the most successful team, having won the title nine times.

A5.text: Argentina, Germany and Australia are joint second best teams, having each won the title twice.

A6.text: The Netherlands won the title defeating Argentina in the final on 24 March.
